unnormalised: Hey there, environmentally conscious folks! Ever wondered what happens to that mountain of garbage piling up in Mumbai, or even just outside your local chaiwala's shop?
normalised: Hey there, environmentally conscious folks! Ever wondered what happens to that mountain of garbage piling up in Mumbai, or even just outside your local chaiwala's shop?

unnormalised: Well, on the waste management front, things are (slowly) changing! IIT Delhi researchers are piloting a new biogas plant using food waste from wedding halls in Delhi-NCR. Imagine, all that delicious, leftover biryani powering streetlights!
normalised: Well, on the waste management front, things are slowly changing! I I T Delhi researchers are piloting a new biogas plant using food waste from wedding halls in Delhi N C R. Imagine, all that delicious, leftover biryani powering streetlights!

unnormalised: The pilot project aims to reduce landfill burden by 30% in the area – that's a lot less stinky mountains we're talking about! The project, funded by the Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change, draws inspiration from the movie 'Lagaan' - gotta find innovative ways to tackle problems with limited resources, right?
normalised: The pilot project aims to reduce landfill burden by thirty percent in the area – that's a lot less stinky mountains we're talking about! The project, funded by the Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change, draws inspiration from the movie 'Lagaan' - gotta find innovative ways to tackle problems with limited resources, right?

unnormalised: Local kabadiwalas (scrap collectors) are also being integrated into the formal waste collection system in Chennai, boosting their income and efficiency. Looks like Swachh Bharat Abhiyan is really getting down to business. Plus, Nagpur is exploring innovative methods of plastic road construction, using over 500 km of recycled plastic so far! Every small step counts, yaars. Let's hope this trend continues!
normalised: Local kabadiwalas scrap collectors are also being integrated into the formal waste collection system in Chennai, boosting their income and efficiency. Looks like Swachh Bharat Abhiyan is really getting down to business. Plus, Nagpur is exploring innovative methods of plastic road construction, using over five hundred kilometer of recycled plastic so far! Every small step counts, yaars. Let's hope this trend continues!
